ElementEnum.RawValue:
ia,Stage IA 
 ib,Stage IB 
 ie,Stage IE 
 iia,Stage IIA 
 iib,Stage IIB 
 iie,Stage IIE 
 iiia,Stage IIIA 
 iiib,Stage IIIB 
 iiie,Stage IIIE 
 iiie_s,Stage IIIE, S 
 iiis,Stage IIIS 
 iva,Stage IVA 
 ivb,Stage IVB

Field.ElementNote: Conditionality Rule: Inclusion based on patient population being studied.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
i,Hodgkin's Disease involves one lymph node group or structure 
 ie,Hodgkin's Disease extends locally to involve a single adjacent site 
 ii,Hodgkin's Disease involves two or more lymph node groups on the same side of the diaphragm 
 iie,Hodgkin's Disease involves one or more lymph node groups on the same side of the diaphragm and there is localized involvement of the node(s) to one organ or site on the same side of the diaphragm 
 iii,Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph node groups on both sides of the diaphragm 
 iii_1,Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph nodes on both sides of the diaphragm with/without involved nodes of the spleen, hilum, abdomen, or liver 
 iii_2,Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph nodes on both sides of the diaphragm with involved nodes of the aorta, iliac artery, or mesenteric artery 
 iiie,Hodgkin's Disease has extended to an organ or site next to the lymph node(s) and/or spleen 
 iv,Hodgkin's Disease has spread to one or more organs or sites outside of the lymphatic system, with/without associated lymph node involvement

StructuredValue.Value: Hodgkin's Disease involves one lymph node group or structure
Hodgkin's Disease extends locally to involve a single adjacent site
Hodgkin's Disease involves two or more lymph node groups on the same side of the diaphragm
Hodgkin's Disease involves one or more lymph node groups on the same side of the diaphragm and there is localized involvement of the node(s) to one organ or site on the same side of the diaphragm
Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph node groups on both sides of the diaphragm
Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph nodes on both sides of the diaphragm with/without involved nodes of the spleen
Hodgkin's Disease involves lymph nodes on both sides of the diaphragm with involved nodes of the aorta
Hodgkin's Disease has extended to an organ or site next to the lymph node(s) and/or spleen
Hodgkin's Disease has spread to one or more organs or sites outside of the lymphatic system

Field.ElementNote: Conditionality Rule: Inclusion based on patient population being studied.
Conditionality Rule: Inclusion based on patient population being studied.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
i,A single tumor (extranodel) or single anatomic area (nodal), with the exclusion of mediastinum or abdomen 
 ii,A single tumor (extranodal) with regional node involvement; Two or more nodal areas on the same side of the diaphragm; Two single (extranodal) tumors with or without regional node involvement on the same side of the diaphragm 
 iii,Two single tumors (extranodal) on opposite sides of the diaphragm; Two or more nodal areas above and below the diaphragm; All primary intrathoracic tumors; All extensive primary intra-abdominal disease; All paraspinal or epidural tumors 
 iv,Any of the Stage I, II, or III criteria with inital CNS and/or bone involvement

StructuredValue.Value: A single tumor (extranodel) or single anatomic area (nodal)

A single tumor (extranodal) with regional node involvement; Two or more nodal areas on the same side of the diaphragm; Two single (extranodal) tumors with or without regional node involvement on the same side of the diaphragm

Two single tumors (extranodal) on opposite sides of the diaphragm; Two or more nodal areas above and below the diaphragm; All primary intrathoracic tumors; All extensive primary intra-abdominal disease; All paraspinal or epidural tumors

Field.ElementNote: Conditionality Rule: Inclusion based on patient population being studied.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
current_diagnosis,Current Diagnosis 
 initial_diagnosis,First Diagnosis 
 restaging,Restaging
